Hi.
As we all know, Mathlib does not contain the implicit function theorem in the familiar form.
According to Wikipedia, the implicit function theorem is written in the following form:

Let XXX, YYY, ZZZ be Banach spaces. Let the mapping f:X√óY‚ÜíZf : X \times Y \to Zf:X√óY‚ÜíZ be continuously Fr√©chet differentiable. If (x0,y0)‚ààX√óY(x_0,y_0)\in X\times Y(x0‚Äã,y0‚Äã)‚ààX√óY, f(x0,y0)=0f(x_0,y_0)=0f(x0‚Äã,y0‚Äã)=0, and y‚Ü¶Df(x0,y0)(0,y)y\mapsto Df(x_0,y_0)(0,y)y‚Ü¶Df(x0‚Äã,y0‚Äã)(0,y) is a Banach space isomorphism from YYY onto ZZZ, then there exist neighbourhoods UUU of x0x_0x0‚Äã and VVV of y0y_0y0‚Äã and a Fr√©chet differentiable function g:U‚ÜíVg : U \to Vg:U‚ÜíV such that f(x,g(x))=0f(x, g(x)) = 0f(x,g(x))=0 and f(x,y)=0f(x, y) = 0f(x,y)=0 if and only if y=g(x)y = g(x)y=g(x), for all (x,y)‚ààU√óV(x,y)\in U\times V(x,y)‚ààU√óV.

So, in my spare time, I formalized it in the above form.
I do not intend to make this PR as it is tedious, but I hope it helps!

import Mathlib

open scoped Topology

variable {X : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup X] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù X] [CompleteSpace X]
variable {Y : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup Y] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù Y] [CompleteSpace Y]
variable {Z : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup Z] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù Z] [CompleteSpace Z]

example
    {f : X √ó Y ‚Üí Z} {x‚ÇÄ : X} {y‚ÇÄ : Y} {dfx : X ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] Z} {dfy : Y ‚âÉL[‚Ñù] Z}
    (hdf : HasStrictFDerivAt f (dfx.coprod ‚Üëdfy) (x‚ÇÄ, y‚ÇÄ)) (hf : f (x‚ÇÄ, y‚ÇÄ) = 0) :
    ‚àÉ g : X ‚Üí Y, (‚àÉ dg : X ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] Y, HasStrictFDerivAt g dg x‚ÇÄ) ‚àß
      ‚àÄ·∂† p in ùìù (x‚ÇÄ, y‚ÇÄ), f p = 0 ‚Üî p.2 = g p.1 := by
  let d : ImplicitFunctionData ‚Ñù (X √ó Y) Z X :=
    { leftFun := f
      rightFun := Prod.fst
      pt := (x‚ÇÄ, y‚ÇÄ)
      leftDeriv := dfx.coprod ‚Üëdfy
      left_has_deriv := hdf
      rightDeriv := ContinuousLinearMap.fst ‚Ñù X Y
      right_has_deriv := hasStrictFDerivAt_fst
      left_range := by
        change LinearMap.range (‚Üë(dfx.coprod ‚Üëdfy : X √ó Y ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] Z) : X √ó Y ‚Üí‚Çó[‚Ñù] Z) = ‚ä§
        rw [ContinuousLinearMap.coe_coprod, LinearMap.range_coprod]
        conv_lhs => arg 2; arg 1; change (‚Üë(‚Üëdfy : Y ‚âÉ‚Çó[‚Ñù] Z) : Y ‚Üí‚Çó[‚Ñù] Z)
        simp
      right_range := Submodule.range_fst
      isCompl_ker := by
        change IsCompl
          (LinearMap.ker (‚Üë(dfx.coprod ‚Üëdfy : X √ó Y ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] Z) : X √ó Y ‚Üí‚Çó[‚Ñù] Z))
          (LinearMap.ker (LinearMap.fst ‚Ñù X Y))
        rw [ContinuousLinearMap.coe_coprod]
        conv => arg 1; arg 1; arg 2; change (‚Üë(‚Üëdfy : Y ‚âÉ‚Çó[‚Ñù] Z) : Y ‚Üí‚Çó[‚Ñù] Z)
        constructor
        ¬∑ rw [disjoint_iff]; ext ‚ü®x, y‚ü©
          simp only [Submodule.mem_inf, LinearMap.mem_ker, LinearMap.coprod_apply,
            ContinuousLinearMap.coe_coe, LinearEquiv.coe_coe, LinearMap.fst_apply,
            and_comm (b := x = 0), Submodule.mem_bot, Prod.mk_eq_zero, and_congr_right_iff]
          rintro rfl; simp
        ¬∑ rw [codisjoint_iff]; ext ‚ü®x, y‚ü©
          simp only [Submodule.mem_sup, LinearMap.mem_ker, LinearMap.coprod_apply,
            ContinuousLinearMap.coe_coe, LinearEquiv.coe_coe, LinearMap.fst_apply, Prod.exists,
            exists_and_left, exists_eq_left, Prod.mk_add_mk, add_zero, Prod.mk.injEq,
            Submodule.mem_top, iff_true]
          use x, dfy.symm (dfx (-x))
          refine ‚ü®?_, rfl, ?_‚ü©
          ¬∑ change dfx x + dfy (dfy.symm (dfx (-x))) = 0
            simp
          use dfy.symm (dfx x) + y
          simp }
  use fun x => (d.implicitFunction 0 x).2
  constructor
  ¬∑ use -(‚Üëdfy.symm ‚àòL dfx)
    have hd :=
      d.implicitFunction_hasStrictFDerivAt
        ((ContinuousLinearMap.id ‚Ñù X).prod (-(‚Üëdfy.symm ‚àòL dfx))) ?_ ?_
    ¬∑ replace hd := hasStrictFDerivAt_snd.comp x‚ÇÄ hd
      simp only [hf, ContinuousLinearMap.snd_comp_prod] at hd
      exact hd
    ¬∑ simp
    ¬∑ ext x; simp
  ¬∑ have hd‚ÇÅ := d.left_map_implicitFunction; simp only [ImplicitFunctionData.prodFun, hf] at hd‚ÇÅ
    replace hd‚ÇÅ := hd‚ÇÅ.curry_nhds.self_of_nhds.prod_inl_nhds y‚ÇÄ
    have hd‚ÇÇ := d.right_map_implicitFunction; simp only [ImplicitFunctionData.prodFun, hf] at hd‚ÇÇ
    replace hd‚ÇÇ := hd‚ÇÇ.curry_nhds.self_of_nhds.prod_inl_nhds y‚ÇÄ
    filter_upwards [hd‚ÇÅ, hd‚ÇÇ, d.implicitFunction_apply_image] with ‚ü®x, y‚ü© hxy‚ÇÅ hxy‚ÇÇ hxy‚ÇÉ
    simp only at hxy‚ÇÅ hxy‚ÇÇ hxy‚ÇÉ ‚ä¢
    constructor
    ¬∑ intro hxy‚ÇÑ
      replace hxy‚ÇÑ := congr_arg (fun z => (d.implicitFunction z x).2) hxy‚ÇÑ
      beta_reduce at hxy‚ÇÑ; rwa [hxy‚ÇÉ] at hxy‚ÇÑ
    ¬∑ rintro rfl
      convert hxy‚ÇÅ
      exact hxy‚ÇÇ.symm
Why not PR it? Nothing wrong with tedious!
PR process. I wrote a whack-a-mole proof so should be golfed, but I can't afford to do that because I am in the middle of the project.
Would you like me to help out by putting a PR together?
@A. Yes, thank you very much!

Just a general remark --- mathematically contentful proofs shouldn't be "golfed", they should be made more readable and more structured! Golfing is only for proofs that no one will ever want to read (including someone in the far future needing to do maintenance for a breakage).
It really surprises me that this community created a positive connotation with the word "golf" when basically every other programming community uses it as a negative term.
Aren't there entire subreddits and stackexchanges dedicated to this positive activity :rofl: ?
There's also the International Obfuscated C Code Contest, but I don't think we should use it for inspiration :laughing:

When I was formalizing the implicit function theorem, I decided to prove a very general version and leave formalizing specialized versions for future, because there are tons of special cases we may need, and it's hard to guess which ones will be useful in practice.
The only question I have about "golfing" or not this proof is "are there parts of the proof that can be moved to reusable lemmas?"
